name: Gamma Neurofeedback
summary: A form of EEG-based neurofeedback training targeting enhancement or regulation of gamma brainwave activity (30–100 Hz) to improve cognitive function, attention, and mental clarity.
description: Gamma neurofeedback trains individuals to increase or regulate gamma frequency brain activity, which is associated with high-level cognitive processing, attention, working memory, and sensory integration. By providing real-time EEG feedback, participants learn to self-modulate gamma activity, potentially enhancing mental performance or addressing clinical symptoms.

delivery_methods: EEG sensors with real-time visual/auditory feedback

off_label_uses: Peak performance in athletes or professionals
clinical_metadata.safety_profile: Well-tolerated; rare reports of mild headache or fatigue.
clinical_metadata.evidence_level: Emerging; small studies support cognitive benefits.
clinical_metadata.research_support: Pilot studies suggest potential improvements in working memory, attention, and executive function.

items: ADHD with attention and executive function deficits

sections.text: Trains voluntary modulation of gamma brainwave activity through operant conditioning with EEG-based real-time feedback, potentially enhancing neuronal synchrony and cognitive integration.

sections.preparation: EEG baseline recording to determine individual gamma frequency targets.
procedure: Placement of EEG electrodes at target scalp sites
Real-time feedback via visual or auditory cues
Reinforcement when gamma activity meets target thresholds
sections.total_treatment_time: 8–40 sessions depending on goals and progress

sections.pre_session: Setup of EEG equipment and baseline check.
sections.treatment_phase: Active neurofeedback training with reward-based cues.
sections.post_session: Review of performance metrics and progress.

immediate: Increased awareness of brain activity patterns

rare: Provocation of seizure in susceptible individuals without clearance

relative: Severe anxiety or mania that could be worsened by stimulation

ideal_candidates: Individuals with attention deficits or seeking cognitive enhancement

studies: Keizer AW, et al. Training gamma band activity improves working memory in healthy participants. Neuroimage. 2010;52(4):1205-1211.
Escolano C, et al. Gamma neurofeedback training in healthy participants: effects on cognitive performance. Front Hum Neurosci. 2014;8:436.
sections.limitations: Small sample sizes; heterogeneity in protocols.

sections.insurance_coverage: Generally not covered for cognitive enhancement; possible coverage for ADHD under neurofeedback.
sections.cost_effectiveness: Potentially cost-effective for motivated individuals seeking long-term improvement.

sections.children: Used for ADHD; requires age-appropriate feedback interfaces.
sections.adolescents: Applicable for ADHD and performance enhancement with consent.
sections.elderly: May aid in mild cognitive impairment; research limited.
sections.comorbidities: Monitor in epilepsy or severe psychiatric disorders.

items: Baseline EEG mapping is recommended before starting.
Protocols may target specific brain regions depending on goals.
Progress tracking enhances motivation and adherence.

seo.title: Gamma Neurofeedback
seo.description: Gamma neurofeedback is an EEG-based brainwave training method aimed at enhancing gamma activity to improve attention, memory, and cognitive performance.
